educational_objective: Diagnose lung cancer on CT scan.
question_text: A 61-year-old man is evaluated for an abnormality found incidentally on a chest radiograph.Chest CT scan is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is lung cancer (Option C). This patient's chest CT scan shows a 2-cm spiculated nodule. A nodule of this size with a spiculated border is highly likely to be malignant. In this case, resection revealed a stage IA adenocarcinoma.
